GAME THAT DESERVES A SEQUEL
GAME THAT DESERVES A SEQUEL

Не буду расписывать как игра хороша потаму как все и так как минимум слышали о втором эпизоде и что он, как говорится "must have". Могу написать только то что игра требует продолжения. Все мы смирились с ожиданием HL3, но надежда умирает последней, ждём и тешим себя мыслью что Гейб не упустит возмозможности подзаработать на франшизе

Жду продолжения!!!

Apart from the OBVIOUS cliffhanger, surprisingly I felt taht this game was a bit easier than Episode 1. Nevertheless, the story continues on, providing more insight to the lore, with plenty of action. Lots of driving around and exploring the world in this one felt a lot less linear, and a lot more open world. Great Game, I'd reccomend the series to others. I WILL NOT STATE THE OBVIOUS NEED THAT EVERYONE WANTS LET VALVE KNOW IN THE STEAM AWARDS!
Ótimo. Só faltou continuarem a história.
This was the second add on episode of Half-Life 2, but really this was a great game by itself.  A great game, highly recommended.   Stays true to what made the original great and more.

Nominate this for "GAME THAT DESERVES A SEQUEL".
Please Valve... make Episode III

Continuing the story of Half-Life 2, Gordan must work with Alyx to stop the Combine forces from using a portal to bring in reinforcement.  

This part of the game is set more in a wilderness area.  It is a fun game to play but does not really offer anything new in gameplay compared to Half Life2 Episode One.  Still, I highly recommend playing this if you have already played Episode One.

Hopefully Valve will create Episode to finish this game trilogy.
Amazing FPS with a great universe and story. Still holds up today, even graphically. Deserves a sequel.

Just submitted my "GAME THAT DESERVES A SEQUEL" Steam Award nomination for "Half-Life 2: Episode Two".

Sixty year old gamer here who wants some closure on this story. Played through HL2 series multiple times on PS2 and PS3. Bought it on Steam to be ready to play again before starting the hoped-for sequel.

C'mon, Mr. Newell. Throw us a bone. Please. We deserve it.
